{{disambig-more: '''Denethor''' (lived in the [[Years of the Trees]]) was the son of the [[Nandor]] [[Elves
Daunted by the towering peaks of the [[Hithaeglir]], Lenwë, his son Denethor, and the Nandor forsook the march of the Elves to the [[Valinor
Denethor: West]] and passed southward down the [[Anduin]]. Much later Denethor would lead a part of those people west into [[Beleriand]].<ref>{{S

{{disambig-more: Centuries before the first rising of the [[Sun]], [[Orcs]] and other foul creatures of [[Morgoth]] began to harass the Nandor east of the [[Blue Mountains]]. Hearing of the power and protection of the Elf King [[Thingol]], Denethor led many of his people over the Blue Mountains into Beleriand.  They settled in [[Ossiriand]] and Denethor became their king. They were called the ''[[Laiquendi]]'' ([[Quenya]] for "Green-elves").

Denethor: 1497}}, [[Morgoth]] loosed an army on Beleriand, beginning the [[First Battle of Beleriand
[[Denethor (disambiguation)]]}}: First Battle]] in the [[Battles of Beleriand
column5: 36}}</ref> The lightly-armed Laiquendi were driven back to the great hill of [[Amon Ereb]], where Denethor was slain.<ref>{{GA
column6: 39}}</ref> While the Laiquendi survived, they became a reclusive people, seldom taking up arms, and never again naming a king.<ref>{{S

{{disambig-more: In an explanation of the name of [[Denethor#Etymology
Denethor: Denethor II]] (who was named after this elf), the Steward of Gondor, it is stated that ''Denethor'' is [[Nandorin]] fit into the [[Sindarin]] sound range, and is said to mean "Lithe and lank".<ref>{{WJ

{{disambig-more: In the earlier ''[[The Lost Road]]'', the name Denethor is said to contain the word element ''Dani''.<ref>{{LR
Denethor: Etymologies}} entry DAN-</ref> According to ''[[The Lhammas]]'', it derives from [[Primitive Elvish]] ''Ndani-thārō'', meaning "Saviour of the Dani", as he was the one who led them to the West. Other derivatives of this name are: ''Daintáro'' in [[Telerin]], ''Nanisáro'' in [[Qenya]], ''Dainthor'' in [[Noldorin]] and ''Denipor'' in [[Doriathrin]].<ref>{{LR
